title: Etiquette of Breaking the Fast (Iftar)
description: Guidelines on the recommended timing for Iftar (preferably after evening prayers) and the most meritorious foods to break the fast with, such as dates, milk, or warm water.

phrases.arabic: الأعمال التي يؤتى بها في ليالي شهر رمضان هي:
phrases.english: The acts of devotion to be observed during the nights of the month of Ramadan are:
phrases.transliteration: Al-a‘māl allatī yu’tā bihā fī layālī shahri ramaḍāna hiya:

phrases.arabic: الإفطار عند دخول وقت الغروب الشرعيّ،
phrases.english: Breaking the fast upon the onset of the religiously prescribed time of sunset.
phrases.transliteration: Al-ifṭār ʿinda dukhūl waqt al-ghurūb al-sharʿī,

phrases.arabic: ويستحبّ تأخيره عن صلاة العشاء إلّاإذا غلب عليه الضعف أو كان له قوم ينتظرونه (4).
phrases.english: It is recommended to delay its performance until after the Isha prayer, unless one is overcome by weakness or is being awaited by a congregation.
phrases.transliteration: Wa-yustahabbu ta’khīruhu ‘an ṣalāt al-‘ishā’ illā idhā ghalaba ‘alayhi al-ḍa‘fu aw kāna lahu qawmun yantazirūnahu (4).

phrases.arabic: أن يفطر بالحلال الخالي من الشبهات (5).
phrases.english: That he break his fast with lawful sustenance, free from all ambiguities (5).
phrases.transliteration: An yuftira bi-l-ḥalāl al-khālī min ash-shubuhāt (5).

phrases.arabic: ويحسن الإفطار بالتمر حيث ورد في الحديث أن من أفطر على التمر ضوعف أجره (6).
phrases.english: It is meritorious to break the fast with dates, as it has been related in the tradition that whoever breaks their fast with dates shall have their reward multiplied (6).
phrases.transliteration: Wa-yaḥsunu al-ifṭāru bit-tamri ḥaythu warada fī al-ḥadīthi anna man afṭara ʿalā al-tamri ḍūʿifa ajruhu (6).

phrases.english: And it is narrated on the authority of Ali (peace be upon him) that he:
It is recommended to break the fast with milk.

phrases.arabic: ويمكن الإفطار بالماء الحار والسكّر والحلوى حيث كان يفطر بها رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله
phrases.english: It is permissible to break the fast with warm water, sugar, and sweets, as the Messenger of Allah—peace be upon him and his family—would break his fast with them.
phrases.transliteration: Wa yumkinu al-ifṭāru bil-mā’i al-ḥārri was-sukkari wal-ḥalwā ḥaythu kāna yufṭiru bihā Rasūlu-llāhi ṣallā-llāhu ‘alayhi wa-ālih.
